pe_description: The Oil, Gas & Coal sub-sector in Indonesia has a P/E ratio of 6.18, lower than the average IDX P/E ratio. This indicates that the sub-sector is currently undervalued compared to the overall market. The sub-sector's P/E ratio has also declined compared to last year, suggesting that investors are less optimistic about its growth prospects. Within the sub-sector, 22 companies outperform the average P/E ratio, while ###PT Transcoal Pacific Tbk.#### is considered overvalued. Some factors that could influence growth within the sub-sector include global oil prices, government regulations, and technological advancements in the energy sector. Investors should carefully consider these factors when making investment decisions in the Oil, Gas & Coal sub-sector.
health_description: The Oil, Gas & Coal sub-sector, comprising 82 companies, ranks 28th in terms of price changes over the past 30 days, underperforming the average IDX price changes. With only 1.22% of companies listing this month, barriers to entry may exist. Out of the 82 companies, 16 exhibited positive price changes. Factors that can influence the sub-sector's health index include government regulations, changes in oil prices, and global economic conditions. The Indonesian government body responsible for regulating the Oil, Gas & Coal sub-sector is the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, whose policies can impact the sub-sector's resilience.
growth_description: The Oil, Gas & Coal sub-sector in Indonesia has experienced significant growth in recent times, with an impressive 31.99% average YoY quarterly earnings change and a remarkable 1637.21% average YoY quarterly revenue change. This sub-sector ranks 16th in terms of earnings and 1st in terms of revenue compared to other sub-sectors. ###Darma Henwa Tbk#### stands out as the company with the highest YoY earnings growth, ###Darma Henwa Tbk#### also has the highest YoY revenue growth, and ###SUMBER ENERGI ANDALAN Tbk#### boasts the highest net profit margin. However, it's important to note that the growth of this sub-sector can be influenced by various factors, including changes in global oil and gas prices, government regulations and policies, technological advancements, and geopolitical events.
